summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) regarding arrangements to access, review, and scan documents, CDs, and cassette tapes from the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators, which are stored in the West Palm Beach office, for use in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of prosecution by the SDNY team; the documents being sought relate to the prior investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators, which includes her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The prior SDFL investigation was into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators; the documents pertain to this case.

connections.description: The document references the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein 'and his co-conspirators,' and the SDNY is prosecuting Maxwell, implying their alleged conspiratorial relationship.

events.title: Scheduling call about Epstein documents
events.description: Email exchange to schedule a call for 3pm to discuss accessing Epstein-related documents stored in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Request for vendor information to scan Epstein files
events.description: SDNY prosecutor requests names of vendors to scan the entire Epstein file and copy CDs and cassette tapes from the SDFL materials.

locations: West Palm Beach Regional Office - SDFL
keyFacts: The SDNY prosecution team for Ghislaine Maxwell sought access to documents from the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein stored in West Palm Beach.
The materials included case files, boxes from an OPR inquiry, CDs, and cassette tapes, with inventories maintained by both SDFL and OPR.
A previous OPR team had successfully scanned documents on-site in West Palm Beach and sent them directly to DOJ accounts.
The SDFL office offered a secure room and a dedicated scanner for the SDNY team's use, similar to the OPR arrangement.
Communication indicates coordination between different U.S. Attorney's Offices (SDNY and SDFL) on the Epstein/Maxwell case.
